revised_title: Spectroscopic and Electrical Studies of All-Trans β-Carotene Crystals
tldr: The authors studied the electronic and infrared absorption spectra of single crystals of all-trans β-carotene, a molecule with semiconducting properties. They measured the dark conductivity and photoconductivity excitation spectra, finding a weak peak at 25,000 cm^-1 and a stronger peak at 13,300 cm^-1. The study provides a foundation for understanding the potential functions of β-carotene in biological situations.
